titles.title: Katie Sepich Enhanced DNA Collection Act of 2012
Katie Sepich Enhanced DNA Collection Act of 2012
To authorize the Attorney General to award grants for States to implement minimum and enhanced DNA collection processes.
To authorize the Attorney General to award grants for States to implement DNA arrestee collection processes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Mr. Smith (TX) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 6014.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
The title of the measure was amended. Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate, read twice.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 6/21/2012--Introduced. Katie Sepich Enhanced DNA Collection Act of 2012 - Directs the Attorney General to make grants to assist states with costs associated with the implementation of minimum or enhanced DNA collection processes. Defines such processes for the purpose of this Act.
